alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 14 at 3:29PM CDT until August 14 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Whiteside County in northwestern Illinois... Eastern Carroll County in northwestern Illinois... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 328 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Wacker to near Como, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Sterling, Rock Falls, Morrison, Mount Carroll, Savanna, Milledgeville, Fairhaven, Tampico, Lyndon, Sabula, Chadwick, Coleta, Emerson, Argo Fay, Ustick, Thomson, Round Grove, Wacker, Ideal and Malvern. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
